definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
skin-deep/superficial/shallow
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to force someone to do something
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
magnanimous
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
greed/avarice/rapacious/avid
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
